title: Altai accentor
text:
The Altai accentor ("Prunella himalayana") is a species of <a href="bird">bird</a> in the family <a href="Prunellidae">Prunellidae</a>. It is also known as the rufous-streaked accentor or Himalayan accentor. It breeds in the <a href="Altai%20Mountains">Altai Mountains</a> of western <a href="mongolia">mongolia</a>; it winters in the southern <a href="Tian%20Shan">Tian Shan</a> and <a href="Himalayas">Himalayan</a> ranges.
Taxonomy.
The Altai accentor was <a href="species%20description">described</a> by the English zoologist <a href="Edward%20Blyth">Edward Blyth</a> in 1842 and given the <a href="binomial%20name">binomial name</a> "Accentor himalayanus". The Altai accentor is now placed in the <a href="genus">genus</a> "<a href="Prunella%20%28bird%29">Prunella</a>" that was introduced by the French ornithologist <a href="Louis%20Jean%20Pierre%20Vieillot">Louis Vieillot</a> in 1816. The species is <a href="monotypic">monotypic</a>.
This species, along with the <a href="alpine%20accentor">alpine accentor</a>, is sometimes separated from the other accentors, into the genus "Laiscopus".
